decision_conditions: The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): L01 (Proposed location plan dated Mar2020); D01 (proposed Cycle Parking dated March2020); D02 (proposed bin stores dated May2020); GS01(proposed section, south west); GS02(proposed section, south east); GS03 (proposed section, north); GS04 (proposed west section);

Design& Access Statement dated November 2019; Planning Statement; Heritage Statement by Dorian Crone & Daniel Cummins dated Nov 2019; Town Visual Impact Assessment; Transport Assessment; Phase 1 Land Quality Assessment by SLR ref: 402.10148.00001 dated Sept 2019; Preliminary Ecological Appraisal ref: 12333_R01c_MB_MM, by Tyler Grange dated Nov 2019; Daylight Sunlight Report prepared by Emily Hyde, ref: 14769 dated 27 Nov 2019; Statement of Community Involvement, London Communications Agency, dated 28 Nov 2019; Landscape Strategy, ref: RLA.GS.PL.01 dated Nov 2019; Landscape Masterplan ref. RLA.GS.PRP.01.6 Rev A; Arboricultural Impact Assessment by Tyler Grange dated November 2019; Noise and Vibration Impact Assessment by H|M dated 18 MARCH 2020 ISSUE: 02 ref. 28208-RPAC-001; Surface Water Drainage Strategy (update) by EAS ref: 2405/2019 Rev D dated June 2020; Air Quality Assessment by Air Pollution Services ref: P1011_A_1 dated 25 Nov 2019; Energy Statement, ref: 19145 by Sustain Quality Ltd dated Nov 2019; Cycle-Works Product Guide - Josta 2-tier; Affordable Housing and Economic Viability Assessment(amended)

And as hereby amended by: 0201 rev P01 (GE01 proposed elevation) ; 0202 rev P01 (GE02 proposed elevation, south east) ; 0203 rev P01 (GE03 proposed elevation, north) ; 0204 rev P01 (GE04 proposed elevation, west) ; 0100 rev P02 (proposed ground floor plan) ; 0101 rev P01 (proposed first floor plan) ; 0102 rev P01 (proposed second floor plan) ; 0103 rev P01 (proposed third floor plan) ; 0104 rev P01 (proposed fourth, sixth & eighth plan) ; 0105 rev P01 (proposed fifth & seventh plan) ; 0106 rev P01 (proposed basement floor plan) ; 0107 rev P01 (proposed roof floor plan)

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Prior to commencement of any works to the superstructure (above ground level), full details and a maintenance programme for the green roofs and the vertical balcony planting, shall be submitted to and approved by Council in writing. These green roofs shall be planted prior to first occupation of the development.

Reason: To ensure that the proposed green infrastructure contributes to sustainable urban greening and is implemented in line with London Plan (2021) policies D3, G1, G5 and SI13; policies SP8, D3 and EU2 of the OPDC  Post Submission Modified Draft Local Plan (March 2021); Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) policies 5.10 and 5.11 | Enforcement Condition: Energy and CO2

a.	Prior to final completion the permitted development shall implement and maintain, and in the case of energy generation equipment confirm as operational, the approved measures to achieve an overall reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 9.69% (equal to 4 tonnes of CO2 per year) beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013. These CO2 savings shall be achieved through the Lean, Clean, Green Energy Hierarchy as detailed in the approved Energy Statement prepared by Sustain Quality in November 2019 including:
i.	Lean passive design measures to achieve an annual reduction of at least 9.69% equating to at least 4 tonnes in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over BR Part L 2013.
ii.	Green renewable energy equipment including the incorporation of a photovoltaic array with a combined total capacity of at least 28.50 kWp to achieve an annual
b.	reduction of at least 32.44%, equating to 12.10 tonnes in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over the Be Lean/Clean stage of the Energy Hierarchy.

c.	Prior to commencement of any works to the superstructure (above ground level) details of the specifications, design and layout of the proposed low and zero-carbon (LZC) energy equipment shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

d.	Prior to completion details of the installed LZC equipment shall be submitted to the Council for approval. The details shall include the exact CHP and/or Heat Pump thermal (and CHP electrical) kilowatt output, heat output pipe diameter(s), monthly energy demand profile, and the exact number of PV arrays, the kWp capacity of each array, the orientation, pitch and mounting of the panels, and the make and model of the panels. The name and contact details of the LZC installation contractor(s), and if different, the commissioning electrical contractor, should be submitted to the Council along with copies of the MCS certificates and all relevant commissioning documentation. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with the approved details.

e.	Within three months of the occupation/first use of the development the relevant Energy Performance Certificate (EPC) and detailed SAP Worksheets showing clearly the TER and DER from the 'as built stage' following completion of the development, shall be submitted to, and approved by, the Local Authority in order to confirm compliance with the energy efficiency measures detailed in the approved Energy Strategy. The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure environmental sustainable development in accordance with policies, SI3 of the London Plan (2021), guidance note 11 of the GLA Energy Assessment Guidance (2018); policies EU9 and EU10 of the OPDC Post Submission Modified Draft  Local Plan (March 2021); policies 5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013), and policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy (2012).
description: Application for a Non-Material Amendment in (S96a) seeking to allow amendments to the approved plans and wording of conditions 8 and 19 to allow initial phases of construction to commence ,in relation to planning permission reference 195346OPDFUL dated 09/09/2020  for ' Construction of a part nine and part four storey building with excavation of basement area to provide 38 self-contained residential units and community space with associated cycle parking, refuse storage, hard and soft landscaping for amenity space and childrens play space (Following demolition of existing building and change of use)'
